titleStmt.title: C. S. Martin et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
May 15 ^th^ 1864 Jackson County Ky
To his Excellency govenor Bramlet

We the undersigned citizens of Jackson county would Most Respectfully Represent to your honor that at the last nov term of our circuit court that John Miller was find fifty dollars charge will carrying of concealed weapons we will say to your honor that the said John Miller is A verry poore man with a small family. And A widow Mother with a family to provide for and is A man of A good moral caracter hard working and industrious and was not at court at the trial But was away from home at work for the government The testimony was that he had on one occasion come home and puld an oald pistol out of his pocket) we hope that you may concur with us and in thinking that he ort not to pay the fine as it is all that we can do to Live out here at this time owing to the great scarcity of provision) and Inter^pose^ you clemency and remit the fine

C S Martin p j j c
M D Suttles Shff of Jack
Henry Faubry Com of School
C. S. Hughs 4 Liet.. 8th Ky. Inf. Vols.
F. K Morris Dpy Pro, Marshall, Co. Ky
S R Baker Lieut of the Malitia of Jackson Co
Allen Hall
Silas Isaacks
P H. West colettor for Jackson Co Internal Rev.
Azariah Martin
J H Baker
G. V. Holland
M. Baleesed
O P Jackson
John Brockman
James R. Baker
Samuel Isaacks
William Campton
James H Purvis
Thos Mcguene
Andson Carpenter
Joph Carper
Wm I Baker J P, J C C
G W Baker JCt S. J. C O
S. W. Biknall
Joseph W. Vanwinkle J. P. J. C.
Owenton L. Azlill
Severe Hurst
I M Abrams
H. G. Donnell

Jackson Cir Ct
John Miller
Pertition
$50
Concealed Weapons
Remit except
fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
Gov
18th June/64
